DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of object used to deliver supplemental radiation for treatment of disease or other conditions.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Supplemental radiation delivered to a specific area of interest, often to the tumor site itself._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Supplemental radiation delivered to a specific area of interest, often to the tumor site itself.

Concepts.definition: Supplemental radiation delivered to a specific area of interest, often to the tumor site itself.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Concepts.definition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/14/22 jk UCSF ISPY-2 AI, released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5/6/19 jk created for Breast Radiation Therapy module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Supplemental radiation delivered to a specific area of interest, often to the tumor site itself._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._Supplemental radiation delivered to a specific area of interest, often to the tumor site itself._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A brass mesh material used to increase the radiation dose at or near the skin surface during chest wall tangent photon radiotherapy. This material is used in place of tissue-equivalent bolus material to achieve improved conformity to the chest wall.

Concepts.definition: A brass mesh material used to increase the radiation dose at or near the skin surface. This material is used in place of tissue-equivalent bolus material to achieve improved conformity to the chest wall.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that there is no device or component that matches the criteria.

Concepts.definition: An indication that there is no device or component that matches the criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tissue-equivalent material placed in contact with the skin to increase the surface dose and/or compensate for missing tissue. A bolus can also be used to compensate for lack of scatter, such as near the extremities or the head during total-body irradiation.

Concepts.definition: A tissue-equivalent material placed in contact with the skin to increase the surface dose and/or compensate for missing tissue. A bolus can also be used to compensate for lack of scatter, such as near the extremities or the head during total-body irradiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
